definition: to inspect a room/to do the rounds (medical)
to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Objective To explore the effect of evidence-based nursing(EBN) in nursing rounds in emergency department.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討運用循證護理在急診科進行護理查房。

sentences.english: She smiled, blessed me and carried on with her round.
sentences.chinese: 她笑了，祈福保佑我，然後去繼續查房了。

sentences.english: Medical experts and the Expert Group to continue to insist on twice-daily rounds.
sentences.chinese: 醫務部和專家組專家繼續堅持每日兩次查房。

sentences.english: Also fluid intake and urine output is often recorded and should be noted and reported on rounds.
sentences.chinese: 此外，還應記錄攝人液體量及尿量以便在查房時報告。

sentences.english: Often it's helpful to review the patient's "active" problem list each day when making rounds.
sentences.chinese: 此外，每天查房時回顧病人目前的問題也很有幫助。

sentences.english: In hospitals, night nurse are making their usual rounds.
sentences.chinese: 醫院裏，值夜班的護士正在例行查房。

sentences.english: Objective To study the effect of using cooperative rounds in cultivating young nurses.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討合作性查房在年輕護士培養中的應用效果。

sentences.english: The ward rounds and treatment start at 8 a. m. every morning.
sentences.chinese: 上午8點鐘醫生開始查房和治療。

definition: to visit a patient at home (of a doctor)/house call
to look after a hospitalized loved one
to hand over to the next workshift
consultation (medical)/to meet for diagnosis/(by extension) consultation of different specialists
sick personnel/person on the sick list/patient
